story.text: A roadside bomb exploded southwest of Baghdad on Monday, killing one soldier, the U.S military said in a statement.Two U.S. soldiers were killed in an explosion in Diyala province northeast of Baghdad on Sunday, the U.S. military said.Following are the latest figures for military deaths in Iraq since the U.S.-led invasion in March 2003:U.S.-LED COALITION FORCES:United States 3,003Britain 127Other nations 123IRAQIS:Military Between 4,900 and 6,375#Civilians Between 52,139 and 57,707*# = Think-tank estimates for military under Saddam Hussein killed during the 2003 war. No reliable official figures have been issued since new security forces were set up in late 2003.* = From www.iraqbodycount.net (IBC), run by academics and peace activists, based on reports from at least two media sources. The IBC says on its Web site that the figure underestimates the true number of casualties.
story.title: factbox - military and civilian deaths in iraq
